review: I bought this to supplement my Google Chromecast with Amazon's good selection of TV shows and movies. This little dongle takes up little space and packs quite a punch in entertainment. The streamlined UI is simple and intuitive to use. I bought this when it was $20, which I consider a great deal. At $40, it's a decent deal, but I would have hesitated to buy it. There are a few reasons for this:- Set up wasn't super easy. It didn't read the device at first. I had to unplug it a few times before it finally would allow me to set it up. It took me about 25 minutes of playing around to finally get it all set up. Chromecast was a lot faster.- It freezes sometimes. Not all the time, but I've had it lag super bad on a few occasions.- Not always reliable. I've tried to watch Netflix and ESPN and it would time out and give me errors. When I switched over to the Chromecast, it worked fine.- It's a first generation device. These quirks and bugs are bound to come up.Overall, its a good product. I've definitely gotten my money's worth for $20. $40 isn't a huge investment, but some of the issues definitely frustrate me. If you have Amazon Prime, it's a great way to watch all the content on your TV instead of your computer. If you don't, I would recommend the Google Chromecast.
